TopicTitle: A ludicrously costly dune buggy (.15 stock)

Articles.Content:
It\'s a revised version of approximately the first thing I did in 0.15 - make a little rover to skate around Minmus. I haven\'t tested it on the Mun yet, but it\'s got more than enough fuel to do less than perfect orbital maneuvering, and it\'s fairly intuitive to operate. It helps to pitch over with W after jettisoning the descent stage so your heading alterations are intuitively A and D. 

Skating

> ![skating.png](http://img684.imageshack.us/img684/1055/skating.png)

On the pad

> ![launchpad.png](http://img209.imageshack.us/img209/781/launchpad.png)

Also, the ASAS is a huge help.

This is great!

Do you use the RCS to get it upright for ascent to orbit or do you use the engine and 'take off' like a plane?

You can do either, but I don\'t really see a reason to bother trying to tilt back. It\'s faster to just take off horizontally.

Personally, I aim for the tallest hill I see, open up the throttle, and do my best Jeb impression as I reach orbit, but that\'s more of a personal preference.
Sounds like completely reckless and irresponsible way to fly - I like it ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
This is now the next payload for the Mun Runner Applications Program. Thanks!
